intro: Alexitoxicon minus, commonly known as the lesser poison ivy, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can cause skin irritation in some individuals. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a heart-shaped appearance. Despite its name, it is not closely related to true poison ivy but shares some toxic properties.
